alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:01AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Moore and eastern Montgomery Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 100 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Biscoe, or 7 miles southeast of Troy, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Pines, Carthage, Pinehurst, Biscoe, Whispering Pines, Robbins, Star, Candor, Taylortown and Norman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued.
